Preparation Package¶

Module DataCleaning¶

Carries functions dedicated to data cleaning or text management.

Authors

Nathan Ramoly

ana.preparation.DataCleaning.clean(text)¶

Performs the actual cleaning: normalize, merge lines and filter short words.

Parameters

text (str) – Text to clean.

Returns

Clean text.

Return type

str

ana.preparation.DataCleaning.filterText(text, threshold=3, numbers=True)¶

Remove short (size <= threshold) words that are irrelevant in analysis. Numbers be ignored by the filter. Performs this task by decomposing the text as a list of words and calling ‘filterWords’.

Parameters

  • text (str) – Text to filter.

  • threshold (int) – Words shorter than the threshold are to be filtered.

  • numbers (int) – Assert if numbers should be filtered. (True if numbers are not filtered). True by default.

Returns

Filtered text.

Return type

str

ana.preparation.DataCleaning.filterWords(tokens, threshold=3, numbers=True)¶

Remove short (size <= threshold) words that are irrelevant in analysis. Numbers be ignored by the filter.

Parameters

  • tokens (list(str)) – List of words.

  • threshold (int) – Words shorter than the threshold are to be filtered.

  • numbers (int) – Assert if numbers should be filtered. (True if numbers are not filtered). True by default.

Returns

Filtered list of words.

Return type

list(str)

ana.preparation.DataCleaning.mergeTextLines(text)¶

Remove line breaks.

Parameters

text (str) – Text with line breaks.

Returns

Text without line breaks.

Return type

str

ana.preparation.DataCleaning.normalizeText(text)¶

Normalizes raw text by removing accents and special characters, lowering the text and removing trailing spaces.

Parameters

text (str) – Text to normalize.

Returns

Normalized text.

Return type

str

Module DataPreparation¶

Provides function to Clean, Transform and Format data in preparation for the ML.

Functions:
loadDataset

Loads the raw data from a directory.

transform

Transforms texts into features thanks to textual feature extraction technique including bow (tf-idf, count, hashing) and Doc2Dev.

prepareData

Load dataset and extract features to prepare data for ML.

prepareDataIly

Same as prepareData, but specifically on Ilyeum contract dataset.

preparationReport

Provides a textual report of the complete preparation process.

Authors

Nathan Ramoly

ana.preparation.DataPreparation.classFilter(segments, labels, classes)¶

Filter the dataset with only selected classes.

Parameters

  • segments (dict(int, str)) – Segments of text to filter.

  • labels (dict(str, str)) – Dictionnary of raw annotation to convert per segment id.

  • classes (list(str)) – List of all accepted class.

Returns

Filtered set of segments of text.

Return type

dict(int, str)

Returns

Filtered labels.

Return type

dict(str, str)

ana.preparation.DataPreparation.cleanSegments(segments)¶

Clean all segments using the DataCleaning module.

Parameters

segments (dict(int, str)) – Raw segments of text.

Returns

Clean segments.

Return type

dict(int, str)

ana.preparation.DataPreparation.convertLabels(labels, classes, binary=False, refClass=None)¶

Convert the string label to numerical one. Binary = if different than one class refClass = list of reference classes

Parameters

  • labels (dict(str, str)) – Dictionnary of raw annotation to convert per segment id.

  • classes (list(str)) – List of all known classes in the domain.

  • Binary (bool) – Convert label into 1 and 0 values, 1 meaning the label matches the reference class, 0 otherwise. The reference classes are provided or, by default, is the first class in the ‘classes’ array.

  • refClass (list(str)) – Reference classes that are to be converted, while the other ones are ignored.

Returns

Set of label/class as numerical values.

Return type

dict(str, int)

Returns

Mapping between textual and numerical labels.

Return type

dict(str, int)

ana.preparation.DataPreparation.debug_tsne_plot(model)¶

Creates and TSNE model and plots it. Used for deub/experiments. From https://www.kaggle.com/jeffd23/visualizing-word-vectors-with-t-sne

ana.preparation.DataPreparation.display_scores(vectorizer, tfidf_result)¶

Debug function. http://stackoverflow.com/questions/16078015/

ana.preparation.DataPreparation.loadDataset(datadir='C:\\Users\\Nara\\Workspace\\datasets\\Contrats\\datasetSentence2')¶

Parameters

Returns

Return type

ana.preparation.DataPreparation.oversampling(X, Y, random=0)¶

Oversample datasets (already transformed) The resulting size of each class set is almost equal.

Parameters

  • X (np.array) – Data to oversample.

  • Y (np.array) – Labels associated to the data.

ana.preparation.DataPreparation.transform(segments, labels, transformer='count', oversample=False, trasnformSerial='.\\models\\vectorizer.pickle')¶

Transform a set of textual segments into features. It offer multiple feature extraction techniques and can oversample the data set classicaly or geneticaly (see TextGeneticOversampler module).

Parameters

  • segments (list(str)) – Raw segments of text.

  • labels – List of raw annotation associated to each segment.

  • transformer (str) –

    • ‘count’ or ‘bow’ (default): standard BOW using sklearn.CountVectorizer.

    • ’tfidf’ or ‘tf-idf’: TF-IDF feature extraction through sklearn.TfidfVectorizer.

    • ’hash’: Uses sklearn.HashingVectorizer

    • ’doc2vec’: DL doc2vec approach provided by Gensim.

  • oversample (bool) – Assert if oversample should be performed or not.

  • trasnformSerial (str (filepath)) – Transform process export path.

Returns

  • Set of data of training (x_train)

  • Set of label of training (y_train)

  • Set of data of testing (x_test)

  • Set of label of testing (y_test)

Return type

np.array

ana.preparation.DataPreparation.transformBOW(segments, labels, segments_test=None, labels_test=None, serialPath='.\\models\\vectorizer.pickle')¶

Apply feature extraction with sklearn.CountVectorizer. It relies on char_wb and an ngram range of [4,5]. .. todo:: Adapt parameter in the AutoML process

Parameters

  • segments (np.array) – Raw segments of text.

  • labels (np.array) – List of raw annotation associated to each segment.

  • serialPath (str (filepath)) – Transform process export path.

  • segments_test (np.array) – Test segments to transform.

  • labels_test (np.array) – List of labels on the test set.

Returns

  • Set of data of training (x_train)

  • Set of label of training (y_train)

  • Set of data of testing (x_test)

  • Set of label of testing (y_test)

Return type

np.array

ana.preparation.DataPreparation.transformDoc2Vec(segments, labels, segments_test=None, labels_test=None)¶

Apply feature extraction with gensim.Doc2Vec. Be aware that this process is heavy.

Parameters

  • segments (np.array) – Raw segments of text.

  • labels (np.array) – List of raw annotation associated to each segment.

  • segments_test (np.array) – Test segments to transform.

  • labels_test (np.array) – List of labels on the test set.

Returns

  • Set of data of training (x_train)

  • Set of label of training (y_train)

  • Set of data of testing (x_test)

  • Set of label of testing (y_test)

Return type

np.array

Module DataSelection¶

Module in charge of selecting data according to the different level of annotation (labels) based on a filter based query. It allows to select data of a particular type or anomalies. It also aggregates lower granules (sentences) to bigger one (clause).

Functions
loadData

Load the text data from a dataset location.

Authors

Nathan Ramoly

ana.preparation.DataSelection.filterLabels(labels, selections)¶

Selects labels according to this template: [ [ [classesA_co1], [classesA_co2] ], [ [classesB_co1], [classesB_co2] ] ] (See loadData explication for filter)

Parameters

  • labels (list(dict(str, list(str)))) – List of labels decomposed by granularity and dimensions.

  • selections (list(list(list(str)))) – Filter query.

Returns

The set of laabels matching the filter.

Return type

list(dict(str, list(str))) (to check)

ana.preparation.DataSelection.loadData(colY, filter=[[[], [], []], [[], []]], granularity=0, datasetFolder='C:\\Users\\Nara\\Workspace\\datasets\\Contrats\\datasetSentence2')¶

Read and load a dataset folder that contains annotation files (csv) and a subdirectories with the raw texts.

Parameters

  • colY (list((int, int))) – The column that should be used for classification (the labels or Y) as: [granularity, column] both as int (pos)

  • filter (list(list(list(str)))) – The list, for each granularity level and each column, of accepted classes (if empty, all class are accepted) granularity is the granulirity that is to be considered (0 highest, ex: clause), if the colY is from a higher granularity, annotation are propagated to children.

  • granularity (int) – Granulirty level used for loading (sentence, clause…), default: 0. Is the higher level, other values are deeper/smaller text decomposition.

  • datasetFolder (str (dirPath)) – Location of the dataset directory.

Returns

The set of values/texts (X).

Return type

dict(str, str)

Returns

The set of associated label (Y).

Return type

dict(str, str)

ana.preparation.DataSelection.loadLabels(datasetFolder)¶

Loard the labels with the following format: Format [dictA, dictB, dictC, …] Granule level: …C in B in A Ids: idA, idA_idB, idA_idB_idC dict: {id, [col]}

For now, it uses default annotatrion csv files.

Parameters

datasetFolder (str (dirPath)) – Location of the dataset directory.

Returns

List of labels decomposed by granularity and dimensions (class domain).

Return type

list(dict(str, list(str)))

ana.preparation.DataSelection.loadText(datasetFolder, labels)¶

Load the raw text according to the selected labels through their ids.

Parameters

  • datasetFolder (str (dirPath)) – Location of the dataset directory.

  • labels (list(dict(str, list(str)))) – List of labels per id.

Returns

Selected raw text

Return type

dict(str, str)

ana.preparation.DataSelection.mergeGranule(data)¶

Merges granules to the upper level. For now, only for higher level (clause). Example: sentences to clause

Parameters

data (dict(str, str)) – Textual subgranules.

Returns

Text for upper level granule.

Return type

dict(str, str)

ana.preparation.DataSelection.recursiveSelect(labels)¶

Filter labels of child granules recurisvely

Parameters

labels (list(dict(str, list(str)))) – List of labels decomposed by granularity and dimensions.

Returns

filtered label

ana.preparation.DataSelection.selectLabel(label, selection)¶

Apply selection on a single label list, that is the labels for one entry for each dimension/domain and granularity

Parameters

  • label (dict(str, list(str))) – Labels for one entry/segment.

  • selections (list(list(list(str)))) – Filter query.

Returns

Label that fits the filter query

Return type

dict(str, list(str)) (to check)

Determine X and Y .. todo:: diff granularity level

Parameters

Module TextGeneticOversampler¶

Provide a class that enrich a text dataset by exchanging parts between two texts, as perform in chromosomes before mitosis.

Class

TextGeneticOversampler

class ana.preparation.TextGeneticOversampler.TextGeneticOversampler(generation=1)¶

class TextGeneticOversampler

Oversamples text samples by generating new sentences by genetic-like merge.

Parameters

generation (int) – Number of exchange process to apply.

fit_resample(X, Y)¶

Performs the actual overfitting by generating new samples/sentences by by genetic combination per class.

Parameters

  • X (np.array) – Text samples.

  • Y (np.array) – Annotation for each text of X

Returns

Oversampled text samples set.

Return type

np.array

Returns

Oversampled text annotation.

Return type

np.array

geneticTextMerge(textA, textB, ordered=False, nbPack=0, mutaRate=0.25)¶

Exchanges packs (subtext) of two sentences/texts, thus generating variation of both texts.

Parameters

  • textA (str) – First text.

  • textB (str) – Second text.

  • ordered (bool, optional) – assert if pack/word should be kept in initial order, defaults to False

  • nbPack (int, optional) – number of text parts that will be exchanged, defaults to 0

  • mutaRate (float, optional) – Mutation rate that represents the rate of exchanged parts in the texts, defaults to 0.25

Returns

First mutated text.

Return type

str

Returns

Second mutated text.

Return type

str

packText(text, nbPack)¶

Transforms a text as a set of pack of words. By default, create packs containing one word each. Packs the granule that are used to create further sentences.

Parameters

  • text (str) – Text to decompose as a set of pack.

  • nbPack (int) – Number of expected packs.

Returns

A set of pack of words.

Return type

list(list(str))
